fields.Title: KIM SWITCH / FORTRESS ACCIDENT
fields.Description: Kim talks to you about Fortress Accident.

fields.Title: START
input
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then there's the Game Master Frequ..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then there's the Game Master Frequency that listens in on the smaller call-in stations. I think that was supposed to coordinate the stories. Functioning as a master of ceremonies of sorts."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay," he concludes. "Let's keep m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay," he concludes. "Let's keep moving."

fields.Title: You: ""I don't know, I'm not an artist.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know, I'm not an artist."

fields.Title: You: ""What do you think happened to the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you think happened to the company?"

fields.Title: You: ""They were insane if they thought t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "They were insane if they thought they could do this."

fields.Title: You: ""You're right, this isn't just a pe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You're right, this isn't just a pen-and-paper role-playing game. They were trying to make it on *radiocomputers*."

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Like he's ready to lay out a fine t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Like he's ready to lay out a fine theory, crafted together like a puzzle box.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like one of those popular..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It looks like one of those popular pen-and-paper role-playing games -- only these people were trying to *automate* it. Make it work on *radiocomputers*."

fields.Title: You: ""Someone tried to exorcise *the cur..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Someone tried to exorcise *the curse* using technology?"

fields.Title: You: ""It's obvious -- this is what remai..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's obvious -- this is what remains of Soona's radio game studio, Fortress Accident."

fields.Title: You: ""And this was a role-playing game?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "And this was a role-playing game?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No idea... They stopped filling ou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No idea... They stopped filling out the schedule on the chalkboard."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, well, *I* think..." The lieu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay, well, *I* think..." The lieutenant takes a step back, steepling his hands.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "His fascination has swept aside oth..."
fields.Dialogue Text: His fascination has swept aside other concerns for the moment. He's a little *hooked*.

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "*Not* in Revachol West, among the r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Not* in Revachol West, among the ruins.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think so. I think they gen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't think so. I think they genuinely believed..." The lieutenant looks around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor.

fields.Title: fortress accident what's going on hub
You: ""Has anyone ever done this before?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Has anyone ever done this before?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Precisely!" He agrees. "It's absol..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Precisely!" He agrees. "It's absolutely mad -- an *automated* role-playing game."

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Utter madness, he thinks -- as a co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Utter madness, he thinks -- as a compliment.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, that *is* the question..." Th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, that *is* the question..." The lieutenant takes a step back, steepling his hands.

fields.Title: Empathy: "He has respect -- and curiosity --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He has respect -- and curiosity -- for this failed endeavour.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And by 'these people' I mean peopl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And by 'these people' I mean people in Soona's radio game company -- Fortress Accident."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What were their ambitions? Because..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What were their ambitions? Because this here looks rather *advanced*."

fields.Title: You: ""How were they planning to do that?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "How were they planning to do that?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Indeed. It's ambitious. And *untet..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Indeed. It's ambitious. And *untethered* from reality, but..." The lieutenant tilts his head, thinking.

fields.Title: Variable["doomed.kimswitch_fortress_concept"]
Variable["doomed.kimswitch_fortress_concept"]
!(Variable["doomed.kimswitch_fortress_concept"])
Interfacing: "Coordinating so many games would ta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Coordinating so many games would take a whole switchboard of people, possibly divided into sub-frequencies.

fields.Title: You: ""Looks like an undercover counterin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Looks like an undercover counterintelligence programme."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A half-smile breaks out on his face..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A half-smile breaks out on his face. "It's too late for that, I'm afraid," he says, looking around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor.

fields.Title: game hub
Jump to: [game hub]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Indeed. Those *welkins* are a dead..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Indeed. Those *welkins* are a dead giveaway." He points to the chalkboard. "Role-playing people love that stuff. The world looks like a modified version of the Wirrâl boardgame... with heat death thrown in."

fields.Title: You: ""Wow." (Conclude.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wow." (Conclude.)

fields.Title: You: ""The curse got them, I see no other..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The curse got them, I see no other explanation."

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "And I don't use the *mad* lightly,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And I don't use the *mad* lightly, he thinks.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like one of those popular..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It looks like one of those popular pen-and-paper role-playing games -- only these people were trying to *automate* it. Make it work on *radiocomputers*."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Super cool! Someone should give the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Super cool! Someone should give them millions of reál *immediately*. This game is too good to be left unfinished.

fields.Title: You: ""Do we have any *money*? Let's give..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do we have any *money*? Let's give them more money so they can finish it and make it even bigger."

fields.Title: You: ""It's just a failed business. The o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's just a failed business. The only question is -- what the hell were they making?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [game hub]
You: ""It was just a play to cheat money..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was just a play to cheat money out of their investor's pockets."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "He's right. This wasn't your grandm..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He's right. This wasn't your grandma's game studio, this is something else.

fields.Title: Variable["church.soona_greeting_done"]
Variable["church.soona_greeting_done"]
!(Variable["church.soona_greeting_done"])
Esprit de Corps: "Utter madness, he thinks -- as a co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Utter madness, he thinks -- as a compliment.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes -- especially in here." The li..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes -- especially in here." The lieutenant looks around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor in front of your feet.

fields.Title: You: ""No time. Let's move." [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: "No time. Let's move." [Leave.]

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, I got that." The lieutenant s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, I got that." The lieutenant shifts on his feet. "What I meant was -- what were they trying to achieve with this damn game..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Through call-in stations." He nods..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Through call-in stations." He nods at the fireplace. "None of the players have to be physically present... Anyone in the world can participate in the game, as long as they have a two-way radio."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "This is *way* above your tiny littl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This is *way* above your tiny little policeman head.

fields.Title: Jump to: [game hub]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""But I don't think *anyone* has att..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "But I don't think *anyone* has attempted to create an *interisolary* game before. We just don't have the technology."

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Like he's ready to lay out a fine t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Like he's ready to lay out a fine theory, crafted together like a puzzle box.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Got you.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Got you."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What do you think is going on here..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you think is going on here with the radiocomputer, chalkboard, and fireplace?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, that's not it. *I* think..." T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, that's not it. *I* think..." The lieutenant takes a step back, steepling his hands.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not to my knowledge. They make aut..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Not to my knowledge. They make automated games in Graad, Messina, Königstein... You know, places with industry."

fields.Title: Jump to: [game hub]
You: ""The world is cold and lonely. This..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The world is cold and lonely. This would keep it company. Let's *finish* it."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah yes, the *doom* of bad business..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ah yes, the *doom* of bad business practices..." The lieutenant looks around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor.
